articles.description: TORONTO — Doctors in Canada’s FIFA World Cup host cities say they’re concerned the already strained health-care system will buckle if a sudden, unexpected surge slams emergency departments during the games. Dr. Catherine Varner, an emergency medicine physician in Toronto, wrote an editor

articles.title: Carney heading to Switzerland to take part in World Economic Forum
articles.description: OTTAWA — Prime Minister Mark Carney heads today to Switzerland for the World Economic Forum in the ski resort town of Davos. Carney is set to give speeches aimed at drumming up investments in Canada, while meeting with leaders of countries, institutions and corporations. U.S. President Donald Trump

articles.title: Inflation rises to 2.4% in December in ‘tax holiday’ rebound: StatCan
articles.description: Statistics Canada says the end of the federal government’s tax holiday a year earlier pushed the annual pace of inflation up two ticks to 2.4 per cent in December. A poll of economists heading into Monday’s data release had expected the annual inflation rate would hold steady at 2.2 per cent. StatCa

articles.title: Public hearing into 2015 Vancouver police beating death of Myles Gray to begin
articles.description: A public hearing into the 2015 police beating death of Myles Gray begins Monday in Vancouver.

articles.title: High-speed train crash in Spain kills at least 39
articles.description: More than 400 passengers were on board the trains that derailed near the city of Córdoba, in Spain's worst rail crash in more than a decade.

articles.title: Inside the mysterious collapse of dark matter halos
articles.description: Physicists have unveiled a new way to simulate a mysterious form of dark matter that can collide with itself but not with normal matter. articles.title: Death toll in Spanish train collision rises to 39 and authorities fear more bodies could be found
articles.description: ADAMUZ, Spain (AP) — Spanish police said Monday that at least 39 people are confirmed dead in a high-speed rail collision the previous night in the south of the country when the tail end of a train jumped the track, causing another train speeding past in the opposite direction to derail.
